name: Sneasel
disruptions:
Board: None
Initial: Adds Barrier to 3rd and 4th column
Timer: Adds 2 Sneasel after 5 turns.
          Adds 2 Sneasel after 3 turns.
          Repeat
recommendedParty:
[Any]/[Lucario]

Heracross, Scyther,
Scizor

Lucario, Xerneas

None
clearingStrategy:
Switch F3 with B6 for a big combo
eliminating the barriers at 3rd and
4th column.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 8 moves left

Clearing Strategy will pretty much do it

Otherwise, use Move+5
mobileNotes:
Catch Rate: 22% +3%

Aside from the catch rate, there is no other
change. Use the same strategy from 3ds.

name: Duosion
disruptions:
Board: Barrier on 1st, 2nd and 3rd Columns,
           Duosions on Barriers at a checkered
           formation
Initial: None
Timer: None
recommendedParty:
[Gengar]/[Banette]

Zoroark, Scyther,
Scizor, Heracross,
Duosion

Yveltal

Giratina
clearingStrategy: Easy with Mega Gengar team
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 5 moves left

Easy without items

Add a Move+5 if it doesn't work
mobileNotes:
100% Same with 3ds version. Still easy with
M-Gengar

name: Snorlax
disruptions:
Board: Many Rocks, 2 Cross-Shaped
          Snorlax formation
Initial: None
Timer: At random: 

Add 2-5 Rocks on the field after 2 turns
Adds 1 column of Rock after 2 turns

Low Health: Adds 2 row of Metal Blocks
                  after 2 turns
recommendedParty:
[Aerodactyl]/[Lucario]/
[Garchomp]

Sawk, Mienshao,
Throh, Conkeldurr,
Pangoro

Lucario

None
clearingStrategy:
C4->E4 then A4->B4 to remove all
Snorlax icons. (a lot of other options
are possible)

With Mega Lucario, this is very easy.
An alternate for Mega Luke is Mega
Aero which is surprisingly good at
this stage
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 27 moves left

A good Fighting Team will also do this with
Move+5. But eventually, you'll get this
S-Ranked when you train your fightings here

Complexity will overkill this if you are
having real trouble. Note that even with
4 Fighting Types (No Mega) this is
really hard

For Garchomp, Mega Start+Move+5
wii do this
notes:
This would be the best grinding 
stage for Fighting type so far..
mobileNotes:
Everything is the same with 3ds version aside
from this stage only gives 50 EXP instead of
55 EXP. M-Lucario/M-Aero is still the best to
use in this stage.

name: Granbull
disruptions:
Board: 16 Granbull in a Cross-Shaped
           Pattern, 4 Metal Blocks
Initial: None
Timer: None

Note: Adds 4 Granbull each time you get
         a combo
recommendedParty:
[Mawile]/[Gengar]

Nidoking, Nidoqueen,
Bronzong, Granbull,
Steelix

None

Dialga
clearingStrategy:
Focus on combos. The Granbull
Disruption will eventually clear
the other Granbulls away

Also M-Gengar is better than M-Mawile
for this stage
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 8 moves left

You may want to bring Granbull with you.
This can S-Rank it without items

If not, add a Move+5
mobileNotes:
Catch Rate: 23% +2%

Nothing change aside from catch rate.

name: Frogadier
disruptions:
Board: Lots of Froakie
Initial: None
Timer: Adds a row of Barrier after every 2
          turns

Note: If Froakie is added as Support
         Pokemon, Frogadier will replace the
         Froakies

[Ampharos]

Grovyle, Raichu,
Lilligant

Zapdos, Raikou,
Sceptile

Shaymin, Tropius
clearingStrategy:
Actually beatable without items but
Move+5 is a safe zone
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 4 moves left

Move+5

DD + Move+5 will do this without problem.
mobileNotes:
100% Same with 3ds version. Team is still
the same

name: Gurdurr
disruptions:
Board: None
Initial: Adds 3 Metal Blocks
Timer: Adds 3 Metal Blocks every turn

36%: Add 2 columns of Metal Blocks
        every turn
recommendedParty:
[Mewtwo]/[Slowbro]

Chimecho, Snubbull,
Slowking
 
Xerneas

Victini
clearingStrategy:
Seems pretty easy at first. But once
the field is full of Metal Blocks that is.
I recommend using Slowbro as your
mega here instead of Mewtwo for
clearing purposes unless you are
using DD which will pretty much kill
this stage with Mega Mewtwo
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 11 moves left

Move+5 with decent team

DD for easy S-Rank
mobileNotes:
HP: 22334
Catch Rate: 17% +1%

The second disruption now occurs when HP
is 27% or lower. Still Mewtwo Y and Gengar
is good at this stage.

name: Quilladin
disruptions:
Board: Rocks everywhere
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 2x2 Rocks,another 2x2 Rocks 
          and 2x2 Metal Blocks every 3 turns
recommendedParty:
[Glalie]

Ninetales, Vanilluxe,
Swellow, Chatot, 
Heracross

Heatran, Blaziken,
Genesect, Moltres

None
clearingStrategy:
Another one of those unbeatable
without items. Use a DD here to 
get through this stage
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 3 moves left

Move+5 will do this good. 

Or add a Disruption Delay if the disruptions
really get in to you
mobileNotes:
Catch Rate: 2% +11%

Catch rate was lowered a little but the stage is
still the same. The stage is still hard so
make sure to test the stage first before trying
with items

name: Shelgon
disruptions:
Board: 4 Shelgons in 1st, 2nd, 5th and 6th
           row with Barrier
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 1 Shelgon every 4 turns

Half Health: Adds 3 Shelgon every 4 turns
recommendedParty:
[Altaria]/[Glalie]/
[Gengar]

Haxorus, Shelgon,
Vailluxe

Dragonite, Xerneas,
Articuno

Rayquaza, Diancie
clearingStrategy:
You have to wait for 4 turns before a
Shelgon spawns and destroy some
barriers. Easy to clear. Just make
sure to catch this one
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 9 moves left

Add Shelgon to your team. This pretty 
much removes most of the barriers on
first turn and will become easy to combo
mobileNotes:
Catch Rate: 3% +3%

Lowered catch rate a little. Still easy if you
add Shelgon to your team. Also Diancie for
Barrier Bash+ is very good to get rid of some
barriers

name: Braixen
disruptions:
Board: 1st row has Metal Blocks protected
           by barriers, Rocks all around
Initial: None
Timer: None
recommendedParty:
[Gengar]/[Aerodactyl]

Buizel, Aurorus,
Marowak, Milotic

Swampert

Keldeo, Gabite, Kyogre,
Groudon, Dialga, Palkia,
Diancie
clearingStrategy:
5 turns before the Metal Blocks 
disappear which is impossible
without any item. Have Keldeo
or Buizel in your party to destroy a
Metal Block and make a combo. If
you have Gabite from the safari, it
can replace Keldeo (or get both if
you want to) Dialga is much better than
the 3 since it will destroy 3 blocks.
Just make sure to activate it (It
is 100% activating at 4 matches)
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 3 moves left

Bringing Keldeo or Buizel do this. You can
also bring Dialga or Gallade if you have
them

You can also try Mega Start Aero for 1 turn
clear
mobileNotes:
HP: 4987
Catch Rate: 17% +4%

Just a little higher HP and lower catch rate. Use
the same strategy with 3ds

name: Steelix
disruptions:
Board: 3rd-6th row: Checkered Pattern
          Onix-Metal Blocks
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 4 Metal Blocks after 3 turns x3
          Adds 4 Metal Blocks, 4 Onix and a
          Row of Metal Blocks after 3 turns
          Repeat.

Notes: Onix falls as a Support Pokemon.
           Will be replaced by Pupitar when
           added to the party
recommendedParty:
[Any]/[Aerodactyl]/
[Garchomp]/[Lucario]

Ninetales, Stunfisk,
Marowak

Lucario, Blaziken, 
Heatran, Entei, Moltres

Groudon
clearingStrategy:
Another really hard stage. Better to buy
a DD for a lot easier.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 13 moves left

Mega Start + DD + Move+5 for this one.
(No DD if using Mega Aero)

With the release of M-Garchomp, it seems
it was doable with just Mega Start
mobileNotes:
HP: 11666
Catch Rate: 14% +2%

The stage become a little harder (2000 more HP)
Use Mega Lucario/Aerodactyl since you
dont have Mega Garchomp. For support, just
use Optimize to get the best Pokemon (You
might want to add Ninetales to help you a bit in
decreasing Metal Blocks). Same strategy with
3ds.DD or Mega Start if you are using M-Lucario
or M-Aerodactyl (Aero is preferred but both works)

name: Blitzle
disruptions:
Board: Lot of Rocks
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 2 Blitzle after 2 turns x2.
          Adds 1 Column of Rocks after 2 turns
          Repeat
recommendedParty:
[Gengar]/[Any]

Marowak, Stunfisk,
Donphan

None

Groudon
clearingStrategy:
You may want to use Gengar to get
large combos here. Making sure to
clear out the last 3 columns first
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 8 moves left

This can be done with Move+5
mobileNotes:
Catch Rate: 27% +3%

Aside from the catch rate, nothing really was
change. Gengar is the best Mega for this stage.

name: Lickilicky
disruptions:
Board: All tiles are Lickitung and Lickilicky
Initial: None
Timer: Randomly regenerate 1 column.
          The column will be like this:

O                      X - Support Pokemon
X                      O - Lickitung/Lickilicky
O
O
X
O

Note: The Lickitung spawn will always be
on 6th Column while the Lickilicky spawn
will be always on 1st column.
recommendedParty:
[Lucario]/[Gengar]/
[Any]

Mienshao, Throh,
Sawk

Lucario

Arceus*
clearingStrategy:
* - Double Normal Team (can consist of
M-Gengar/M-Luke, Lickitung, Lickilicky,
and Arceus

For first time, you may want Lickitung
with you. This will lessen the Pokemons
in the board and get combos without
using a move.

B6 to E6 is a good starting move
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 11 moves left

Bring both Lickitung and Lickilicky.

You may want to add a Move+5 if needed.
If Lickilicky/Lickitung strategy fails, just
go for your normal Fighting Team
mobileNotes:
Catch Rate: 20% +4%

Again. Just catch rate difference. All Pokemon
on 3ds version are also available in here.
(Except for Double Normal Arceus Team)

name: Pangoro
disruptions:

Timer: Adds 2 Pancham every 2 turns

Salamence, Braviary
 
Xerneas

Victini, Cresselia,
Lugia

You may want to try bringing Pancham
here for extra combos if this is getting
hard for you

If you have Lugia, this will be a piece
of cake with its Eject+. Dont bring
Pancham here if you would bring Lugia
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 8 moves left

Beatable at Itemless.

Add a Move+5 if you are
getting trouble
mobileNotes:
HP: 13182

Has 2800+ more HP than 3ds version. Expect
this a little bit harder. Still S-Rankable with
Move+5.

In any case you are getting short, a

name: Doublade
disruptions:
Board: Random no. of Klefki

Timer: Adds 1 Column of Rocks after 3

[Any]/[Lucario]/[Gengar]

Stunfisk

Blaziken, Heatran,
Lucario, Moltres

Groudon
clearingStrategy:
This is beatable without items but
you'll need high levels here (5+)
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 11 moves left

Use a DD.

Buy Move+5 to be safe.
A high level team can go with just
Move+5
mobileNotes:
100% same with 3ds version. GS may think
that this stage is hard enough. This is
easier in Mobile since a lot of new Pokemon are
now available. If you have Ho-Oh and Landorus,
they are better alternative to Pokemon that has
lower BP. Use Ninetales instead of Machamp
(Eject does not work on Klefki)

name: Cofagrigus
disruptions:
Board: Black clouds except 4th row
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 5 Rocks after a turn
           Adds 5 Rocks and 5 Black Clouds
           after a turn
           Repeat
recommendedParty:
[Gengar]/[Banette]

Banette, Zoroark,
Mightyena, Liepard
 
Yveltal

Giratina
clearingStrategy: Easy with Mega Gengar team

Moves: At least 5 moves left

Match as many Gengar as possible to
Mega evolve it.

Or get DD if you are
having trouble (I prefer the itemless)
mobileNotes:
Catch Rate: 5% +5%

The catch rate from 55% goes down to 5%.
Same with 3ds version aside from that

name: Reuniclus
disruptions:
Board: None
Initial: Adds 4 Barriers x2
Timer: Adds 4 Barriers x3 every 5 turns

Notes: Seems to add Barriers only at the
           center boards and do not affect all
           sides
recommendedParty:
[Gengar]/[Banette]

Zoroark, Scyther,
Scizor, Heracross

Genesect, Yveltal


Giratina
clearingStrategy:
You have a lot of turns and the
Disruption was not that hard. It even
adds barrier to blocks that already
has barrier. Genesect/Heracross on
a Mega Gengar team will do a lot of
damage here
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 15 moves left

Dont know what is with this stage that
it requires only 2 turns left. No items
needed. Pretty much S-Ranked on
first clear
mobileNotes:
S-Ranking: 15 moves.

This stage was fixed and clearing the stage with
2 moves will not yield a S-Rank. 30 moves is
a lot. Gengar is the best Mega here. Giratina
and Genesect can do the damage. Absol's
Mind Zap will reset its disruption (it is per 5
turns) so use it to stop the barriers. Recommended
item is Move+5 for S-Ranking

name: Conkeldurr
disruptions:
Board: 1st, 3rd, 4th, 6th rows are Rocks
Initial: None
Timer: None

Notes: Rocks will also skyfall

1/3 Health: Adds 4-5 Rocks per turn
recommendedParty:
[Aerodactyl]/[Slowbro]

Azumarill, Slurpuff,
Chatot, Braviary,
Salamence
 
Xerneas, Mewtwo


Victini, Cresselia
clearingStrategy:
Slowbro or
Aerodactyl for good combos. Also
dont use Mega Mewtwo Y here
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 12 moves left

Move+5, Mega Start and a 
decent Mega Aero/Mega Slowbro team.

If you really cant do it, then try adding a
Complexity
mobileNotes:
100% same with 3ds version.
Same strategy with 3ds version

Delphox

None

Switch D3 with C3 or switch B1
with D3 to make Tangrowth remove

Moves: At least 8 moves left

Your team can do this if you remove
the disruptions
mobileNotes:
HP: 13416
Catch Rate: 25% +3%

That is 4500+ more HP than 3ds version. 3ds
version was easy anyway. The strategy for
3ds still works in here. If itemless cannot do this,
try adding a Move+5.

name: Tyranitar
disruptions:
Board: Rocks everywhere
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 1 Row of Metal Block after 3
          turns x2.
          Adds 1 Row of Metal Blocks, 4
          Rocks and 5 Tyranitar and another
          4 Rocks

Notes: Rocks will skyfall
recommendedParty:
[Lucario]/[Mawile]/
[Blastoise]/[Venusaur]/
[Garchomp]

Stunfisk

Swampert, Suicune

Kyogre, Groudon,
Dialga
clearingStrategy:
You may also try Mega Aero if it is
effective for you.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 15 moves left

Seems to be doable with just Move+5.
You will need a good team to do this
(Hint: M-Garchomp+Dialga for destroying
disruptions)

Move+5 and Mega Start can also be
good if you dont have Dialga or Garchomp.
mobileNotes:
HP: 18345

Aside from the HP increase (about 1500+)
no really change from 3ds version. Mobile
version don't have M-Garchomp yet so you should
stick with other Megas. Blastoise, Lucario or
Mawile can be great. You may need a Mega
Start only if your Mega is slow

Move F1 to D6 to clear all the Rocks
on first turn

Really easy to S-Rank. Might want to
get a Move+5 if having trouble

name: Weavile
disruptions:
Board: None
Initial: Adds Barrier in 1st-2nd or 5th-6th
          Column.
Timer: Adds Barrier in 1st-2nd or 5th-6th
          Column after a turn
          Adds 1 Column of ice after every 5
          turns
recommendedParty:
[Lucario]/[Heracross]/
[Any]

Conkeldurr, Snubbull,
Mienshao, Heracross

Lucario, Xerneas,
Genesect

None
clearingStrategy:
After the initial disruption, move will
depend on what column the barriers is:

1st-2nd: Move C5 to C6 to clear
all barriers
 5th-6th: Move D5 to D6 clearing
all Barriers.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 9 moves left

This one is another very easy without
items.

For those who are getting trouble itemless,
a Move+5 will be enough

name: Avalugg
disruptions:
Board: 10 Barriers
Initial: None
Timer: None

Notes: Adds 1 row of Barriers if no combo.
Half Health: Adds 5 Barriers after every turn
recommendedParty:
[Lucario]/[Blaziken]/
[Gengar]/[Any]

Tyranitar, Conkeldurr,
Steelix, Ninetales

, Heatran, Blaziken,
Moltres, Delphox

Dialga, Jirachi
clearingStrategy:
You may want to get at least a 2
combo every turn or else you'll get
clog in barriers. Not really much that
hard. M-Gengar is good at combos if
you are getting some trouble

Also note you may need some items
if you are using M-Blaziken team
unless you are lucky with combos
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 13 moves left

If you are having trouble itemless,
Move+5 will do this

Or go with Move+5, DD, Mega Start
(I used only DD, depends on your team
level)

trouble

Shaymin, Kyogre,

clearingStrategy:
Glalie and Blastoise are both good.
Glalie for combo and Blastoise for
clearing Blocks. Not that hard.

It seems that you can use Tropius to
Eject the Excadrill at the bottom and
clear the board with Rocks. The
problem is if you can have a Tropius
match on your first turn

Moves: At least 15 moves left

Glalie+DD will do this

If short on Moves, try adding a Move+5

name: Zebstrika
disruptions:

[Gengar]

Groudon
clearingStrategy:
Your usual Damage Streak team here.
The Disruptions isn't much trouble

name: Salamence
disruptions:
Board: None
Initial: Adds 3 Barriers
Timer: Adds 3 Barrier every 2 turns
recommendedParty:
[Manectric]/[Ampharos]/
[Glalie]/[Any]

 Tyranitar, Aurorus,
Avalugg

 Articuno, Zapdos, 
Raikou

Kabutops
clearingStrategy:
You can beat this itemless. Not really
hard once you have your Mega. You 
can also try your newly caught Avalugg
here for Barrier Bash

Kabutops was released in an event,
so if you are going back to this stage
for an S rank or if you just caught
Kabutops before this stage, it is Super
Effective and has Barrier Bash+.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 9 moves left

Move+5 and this one is easy to S-Rank
I must say this isnt hard unlike Tyranitar

If you still cant do this with the above
strategy, adding a DD can help you
(Try matching more for combos than
using Avalugg's Barrier Bash)

name: Mega Heracross
disruptions:
Board: More Rocks
Initial: None
Timer:  Adds 2-5 Rocks after 5 turns.
           Adds a vertical 4 Rocks after a
           turn x4.
           Repeat.

Note: Illumise falls as a Support Pokemon.
         If Illumise is added as support,
         Shuckle will replace Illumise
recommendedParty:
[Aerodactyl]/[Blaziken]

Aurorus, Tyranitar,
Braviary, Salamence

Blaziken, Heatran,
Moltres

None
clearingStrategy:
Mega Aero will clear all blocks here
easily.

For those using M-Blaziken, you may
want to only want to clear out Illumise
if it is clogging the board.

A4 to E3 will remove the Rocks at the
center leaving 3 Rocks at each side
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 12 moves left

Move+5 and Mega Start Aerodactyl or
Move+5 and DD M-Blaziken will
do this with a decent team

Complexity+Mega Start seems to be a
more efficient strategy for this. Also never
use DD if you are using M-Aero or you'll
waste M-Aero's power

M-Rayquaza with Mega Start and Moves +
makes S ranking this stage quite easy.
